FuncDef: To configure a Multicast VLAN Registration (MVR) group for an interface, use the mvr group command. To remove the MVR group from an interface, use the no form of this command.
CLIs: mvr group { | | < group_IP_address> | <IP_prefix> / <length> } [ count <count_value> ] [ vlan <vlan_ID> [ . . . vlan <vlan_ID> ] ]
no mvr group { <group_IP_address> | | <IP_prefix> / <length> } [ count <count_value> ] [ vlan <vlan_ID> [ . . . vlan <vlan_ID> ] ]

ParaDef.Info: Group IP address in the format A . B . C . D .
IP prefix and network mask length in the format x . x . x . x / m .
Specifies the count value. The range is from 1 to 64.
Specifies the global default MVR VLAN. The range is from 1 to 4094.

ExtraInfo:
You can use this command on the following interfaces:Before you use a virtual Ethernet interface, you must enable the Cisco Virtual Machine Fabric Extender (VM-FEX) on the switch by using the feature vmfex command.This command does not require a license.
Command Default: None
msg: Error CLI:mvr group { | | < group_IP_address> | <IP_prefix> / <length> } [ count <count_value> ] [ vlan <vlan_ID> [ . . . vlan <vlan_ID> ] ]
Error CLI:no mvr group { <group_IP_address> | | <IP_prefix> / <length> } [ count <count_value> ] [ vlan <vlan_ID> [ . . . vlan <vlan_ID> ] ]
